column1: Task
Adjust and repair assistive devices and make adaptive changes to other equipment and to environments.
Arrange bottles and glasses to make attractive displays.
Assemble and modify existing pieces of equipment to meet special needs.
Assist in the cleanup of hazardous material spills.
Build landscape, architectural and display models.
Build prototypes from rough sketches or plans.
Check victims for signs of life, such as breathing and pulse.
Compose and frame each shot, applying the technical aspects of light, lenses, film, filters, and camera settings in order to achieve the effects sought by directors.
Conduct research to develop and test surgical techniques that can improve operating procedures and outcomes.
Conduct, or assist in conducting, research, including the collection of information and samples, such as blood, water, soil, plants and animals.
Create and change in-store and window displays, designs, and looks to enhance a shop's image.
Create and install special effects as required by the script, mixing chemicals and fabricating needed parts from wood, metal, plaster, and clay.
Create decorative textures in finish coat, using brushes or trowels, sand, pebbles, or stones.
Create freehand drawings and lettering to accompany drawings.
Create pen-and-paper images to be scanned, edited, colored, textured or animated by computer.
Create specialty dishes and develop recipes to be used in dining facilities.
Decorate gardens with stones and plants.
Design and create, or requisition, special supplies and equipment, such as splints, braces and computer-aided adaptive equipment.
Design and fabricate experimental apparatus to develop new products and processes.
Design and set up advertising signs and displays of merchandise on shelves, counters, or tables to attract customers and promote sales.
Design fixtures, tooling, and experimental parts to meet special engineering needs.
Design layouts of audio and video equipment, and perform upgrades and maintenance.
Design, fabricate, and repair assistive devices and make adaptive changes to equipment and environments.
Determine how food should be presented, and create decorative food displays.
Determine the effects of drug therapies, antibiotics, or new surgical techniques by testing them on animals.
Devise, fabricate, and assemble new or modified mechanical components for products, such as industrial machinery or equipment, and measuring instruments.
Diagnose malfunctioning systems, apparatus, and components, using test equipment and hand tools, to locate the cause of a breakdown and correct the problem.
Dismantle malfunctioning systems and test components, using electrical, mechanical, and pneumatic testing equipment.
Examine and observe animals in order to detect signs of illness, disease, or injury.
Examine animals to detect and determine the nature of diseases or injuries.
Examine brickwork or structure to determine need for repair.
Examine crime scenes to obtain clues and evidence, such as loose hairs, fibers, clothing, or weapons.
Gather and edit raw footage on location to send to television affiliates for broadcast, using electronic news-gathering or film-production equipment.
Inspect fire sites after flames have been extinguished in order to ensure that there is no further danger.
Inspect fire sites after flames have been extinguished to ensure that there is no further danger.
Inspect physical conditions of warehouses, vehicle fleets and equipment, and order testing, maintenance, repair, or replacement as necessary.
Inspect premises to identify infestation source and extent of damage to property, wall and roof porosity, and access to infested locations.
Install rock gardens, ponds, decks, drainage systems, irrigation systems, retaining walls, fences, planters, and/or playground equipment.
Modify, devise, and maintain equipment used in operations.
Monitor installation of plumbing, wiring, equipment, and appliances to ensure that installation is performed properly and is in compliance with applicable regulations.
Move toward the source of a fire using knowledge of types of fires, construction design, building materials, and physical layout of properties.
Move toward the source of a fire, using knowledge of types of fires, construction design, building materials, and physical layout of properties.
Observe animals' physical conditions in order to detect illness or unhealthy conditions requiring medical care.
Obtain and assemble data to complete architectural designs, visiting job sites to compile measurements as necessary.
Open safe locks by drilling.
Operate diagnostic equipment such as radiographic and ultrasound equipment, and interpret the resulting images.
Operate equipment to produce programs or broadcast live programs from remote locations.
Operate experimental pilot plants, assisting with experimental design.
Operate television or motion picture cameras to record scenes for television broadcasts, advertising, or motion pictures.
Organize, develop, analyze, test, and prepare special meals such as low-fat, low-cholesterol and chemical-free meals.
Orient self in relation to fire, using compass and map, and collect supplies and equipment dropped by parachute.
Oversee construction and testing of prototype in model basin and develop sectional and waterline curves of hull to establish center of gravity, ideal hull form, and buoyancy and stability data.
Patrol burned areas after fires to locate and eliminate hot spots that may restart fires.
Perform emergency work during off-hours.
Perform environmental quality work in field and office settings.
Perform oral and periodontal surgery on the jaw or mouth.
Perform testing, maintenance, repair, and upgrading of accelerator systems.
Photograph damage and evidence related to causes of fires or explosions in order to document investigation findings.
Photograph layouts, using camera, to make layout prints for supervisors or clients.
Plan and conduct field surveys to locate new sites and analyze details of project sites.
Plan and cultivate lawns and gardens.
Position patient on operating table to maximize patient comfort and surgical accessibility.
Prepare sketches, floor plans or models of proposed displays.
Produce still and animated graphics for on-air and taped portions of television news broadcasts, using electronic video equipment.
Protect property from water and smoke, using waterproof salvage covers, smoke ejectors, and deodorants.
Provide assistance during emergencies by operating floodlights and generators, placing flares, and driving needed vehicles.
Record and edit audio material such as movie soundtracks, using audio recording and editing equipment.
Remove damaged panels, and identify the family and properties of the plastic used on a vehicle.
Remove deceased remains from place of death.
Restore form and function by moving skin, bone, nerves, and other tissues from other parts of the body in order to reconstruct the jaws and face.
Review performance reports and documentation from customers and field engineers, and inspect malfunctioning or damaged products to determine problem.
Script, plan, and create animated narrative sequences under tight deadlines, using computer software and hand drawing techniques.
Search burning buildings to locate fire victims.
Season and cook food according to recipes or personal judgment and experience.
Secure deceased body and obtain evidence from it, preventing bystanders from tampering with it prior to medical examiner's arrival.
Select and assemble cameras, accessories, equipment, and film stock to be used during filming, using knowledge of filming techniques, requirements, and computations.
Select flora and foliage for arrangements, working with numerous combinations to synthesize and develop new creations.
Set up cameras, optical printers, and related equipment to produce photographs and special effects.
Support metalworking projects from planning and fabrication through assembly, inspection, and testing, using knowledge of machine functions, metal properties and mathematics.
Take photographs from all angles of relevant parts of a crime scene, including entrance and exit routes and streets and intersections.
Test cooked food by tasting and smelling it in order to ensure palatability and flavor conformity.
Test drive trucks and buses to diagnose malfunctions or to ensure that they are working properly.
Test new food products and equipment.
Tilt, dip, and turn suspended loads to maneuver over, under, and/or around obstacles, using multi-point suspension techniques.
Tour grounds, such as parks, botanical gardens, cemeteries, or golf courses, to inspect conditions of plants and soil.

Train horses or other equines for riding, harness, show, racing, or other work, using knowledge of breed characteristics, training methods, performance standards, and the peculiarities of each animal.
Travel in trucks, helicopters, and airplanes to inspect lines for freedom from obstruction and adequacy of insulation.
Use cameras in any of several different camera mounts such as stationary, track-mounted, or crane-mounted.
Visit site and record information about access, drainage and topography, and availability of services such as water and electricity.
Weigh, measure, and mix ingredients according to recipes or personal judgment, using various kitchen utensils and equipment.
